title: Add fee-management app at /fees with 12-month tracking and Motoko storage

requirements.text: Add an in-app route at the URL path "/fees" that renders a fee-management app while keeping the existing marketing landing page unchanged at "/".

quotes: Do you want the "Fee App" to be opened by ... 3. A separate URL like /fees
To add the fee‑management app at /fees, I will generate: • A new React page for /fees

acceptanceCriteria: Visiting "/" shows the current Ganapati Coaching Centre marketing page with all existing sections and existing user-facing text unchanged.
Visiting "/fees" shows the fee-management app UI.
There is an in-UI navigation element that lets a user go from the marketing page to "/fees" and back to "/".
No edits are made to immutable frontend paths (including frontend/src/main.tsx and the auth/actor hooks).

requirements.text: Implement the fee-management app UI at "/fees" with two modes: (1) Admin panel to add students with fields Name, Phone, and PIN; and (2) Student login using PIN to view a 12-month (Jan–Dec) paid/unpaid status card.

quotes: Build the fee app with this website
• Admin panel to add students (Name, Phone, PIN) • Student login using PIN • Monthly fee card showing Paid / Unpaid
How many months should the fee tracker show? • 12 months (Jan to Dec)

acceptanceCriteria: Admin panel supports creating a student record with Name, Phone, and PIN and shows a confirmation on success.
Student login screen accepts PIN and, on success, shows the logged-in student’s details and 12 months labeled Jan, Feb, Mar, Apr, May, Jun, Jul, Aug, Sep, Oct, Nov, Dec.
For a logged-in student, each month visibly indicates Paid or Unpaid.
All user-facing UI text added for the fee app is in English.

requirements.text: Enable admin actions to mark monthly fees as paid/unpaid for a selected student for each of the 12 months (Jan–Dec), and persist those changes.

quotes: • Admin can mark fees as paid
• Admin panel: add students (Name, Phone, PIN) • Student login by PIN • Monthly fee card • Motoko backend storage

acceptanceCriteria: Admin can select an existing student and toggle each month’s status between Paid and Unpaid.
Toggling a month immediately updates the UI and remains consistent after a page refresh (persistence).
Students cannot change payment status from the student view (read-only).

requirements.text: Implement a Motoko backend in backend/main.mo to store students and their 12-month fee status, and expose canister methods for: creating students, listing students for the admin UI, student PIN login, reading a student’s fee status, and updating a month’s paid/unpaid status.
acceptanceCriteria: backend/main.mo is no longer empty and provides working canister methods needed by the fee app UI.
Data is stored in stable state so students and paid/unpaid statuses persist across canister upgrades.
Methods validate inputs (e.g., month index is within 0–11, PIN is non-empty) and return clear error results that the frontend can display in English.

requirements.text: Integrate the frontend fee app with the backend using the existing actor creation pattern (useActor hook) and React Query for loading/mutating students and fee statuses.
acceptanceCriteria: All fee app data operations (create student, list students, login, update month status) call the Motoko canister via the existing actor setup.
React Query is used to fetch/cache fee app data and invalidate/refetch after mutations so the UI stays consistent.
The marketing landing page remains functional and visually unchanged.

constraints: Keep the existing marketing landing page layout, responsiveness, and all existing user-facing text unchanged.
Do not edit any files under frontend.immutablePaths (including frontend/src/main.tsx, frontend/src/hooks/useInternetIdentity.ts(x), frontend/src/hooks/useActor.ts, and frontend/src/components/ui).
Backend must remain single-actor architecture with all Motoko logic in backend/main.mo; create backend/migration.mo only if required for stable state upgrades.
Use 12 months Jan–Dec for fee tracking.
nonGoals: Internet Identity-based role management or admin authentication (no requirement was provided for admin credentials).
Payments, receipts, invoicing, SMS/WhatsApp/email notifications, or real-time updates.
Changing the existing visual theme (teal/cyan + slate + mint) or replacing the existing Ganesh logo asset.
